cab.content:
This Document is the Property if His Britannic Majesty's Government.
SECRET
C.P. 841 TELEGRAM from the Governor General of Canada to the Secretary of State for the Colonies.
(Dated 19th January).
(Received Colonial Office 8.50 a.m. 29th January 1920).
January 19th. My Ministers would be glad to be informed generally of the present position respecting disposition of Armenia and of the prospect for settlement of the question in the near future. There are indications that much concern exists in Canada over fate of this country and that there will be strong feeling against proposal to subject it again to Turkish rule.
DEVONSHIRE. IzlEttMMi From the Governor General of Canada to the Secretary of State for the Colonies.(Da-bed 11-th February) (Received Colonial Office, 6.20 a.rn. 12th February 1920)l-* *-* *** (*t l-*11th February, In vie?/ of,approaching Session of Parliament and likelihood of questions on subject x$ Ministers would be glad to have reply to my telegram 19th January respecting Armenia.DEVONSHIRE, telegram-RAM: From the Secretary of State for the Colonies to the Governor General of Canada, (Sent 5.45 p.m, 21st February, 1920)21at February.Your telegram 19th January. Your telegram 11th February respecting Armenia. I regret that it is not yet possible to give any definite reply. Peace Conference are at present actively engaged in consider-ing question how protection of Armenian populations of Turkish finpire may be secured and promises mads to them redeemed and the arrangements that are under discussion will keep both these ends in view, Results of discussions will be communicated as soon as possible. 1 j 2TELMUM from the Governor General of Canada to the Secretary of State for the Colonies,Dated 5th March (Received Colonial Office 10.40 p*m. 5th March 192 0)5th March Great deal of interest in Turkish Treaty negotiations is being manifested in Canada and since Treaty mist be submitted to Parliament for approval my Ministers feel They should be kept advised on general outline of purposed conditions cf peace especially those relating to territorial readjustment a to the Armenians and to control of Straits at present they have little knowledge beyond what appears in press notwithstanding my telegram 19th January and my telegram 11th. February they would be glad to have full report of present position and of proposals now under consideration*DEVONSHIRE,
